Title: Analysis of determining factors for successful student's GPA achievement
Source title: Proceedings - 11th 2016 International Conference on Knowledge, Information and Creativity Support Systems, KICSS 2016
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Debora Suryawan, A., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Putra, E., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Universities are required to prepare the best quality graduate. Therefore, they will be ready to contend and to be an ambitious individual in the real world. All graduates are judged by their Grade Point Average (GPA). Therefore, in Indonesia, it is critical to maintaining a good GPA from the first semester until the graduation. Although the student is the main actor, it is not only their job to maintain the GPA. The good-grade university also needs to participate by helping them to get the best help and environment during the lecture. The university should able to create conducive learning environment to support and to help undergraduate students in maintaining a good GPA. The purposes of this paper are to identify and analyze the factors that affect a good performance of student's GPA, to give suggestions to education institution as a preventive action of low performance of student's GPA, and to design a successful model to achieve good GPA. Methodologies used in this paper are literature study, analysis at the University, model trial, and giving the result and solutions. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: GPA; Grade Point Average; graduate; undergraduate students; university
Index Keywords: Computer aided instruction; Education; Education computing; Education institutions; Grade point average; graduate; Learning environments; Literature studies; Preventive action; Undergraduate students; university; Students

Authors: Suryawan A.D., Putra E., Pratiwi A.
Title: Knowledge management strategy model for small to medium enterprises
Source title: Proceedings - 2015 International Conference on Science in Information Technology: Big Data Spectrum for Future Information Economy, ICSITech 2015
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Suryawan, A.D., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Putra, E., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Pratiwi, A., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The focus of knowledge management is not only for academic but already a realization that knowing about knowledge is critical for business growth and business survival. Knowledge management is known as one of the key factors for the enterprises to have a sustainable competitive advantage. Many enterprises would like to have knowledge management implemented in their company but they are often confused about the direction how to create a successful knowledge management and this point is especially true for small to medium enterprises (SMEs). Besides the blurry of the step in creating a good knowledge management for SMEs, they also have a lot of doubts of it as knowledge management may costs too much. This skepticism drives SMEs owner to be afraid to spend their resources to implement a knowledge management and it may make them lose their competitive advantage. Methodologies for this research are literature view, observations, interview, and case study. This research is focus to create a model of knowledge management strategy that may help SMEs to better understanding about the useful of knowledge and how to implement the model easily. © 2015 IEEE.
Author Keywords: knowledge; knowledge management; knowledge management strategy; knowledge management success model; small and medium enterprises; sustainable competitive advantage
Index Keywords: Big data; Competition; Digital storage; Sustainable development; knowledge; Knowledge management strategy; Knowledge management success; Small and medium enterprise; Sustainable competitive advantages; Knowledge management
